maml:description.maml:para: Expand an object representing a security principal and into a collection of objects respresenting the access control entries for that principal
Expand an object from Format-SecurityPrincipal (one object per principal, containing nested access entries) into flat objects (one per access entry per account)
Object that was output from Format-SecurityPrincipal

Properties to exclude from the output because they cause problems or are unnecessary/redundant/undesirable All properties listed on a single line to workaround a bug in PlatyPS when building MAML help (error is 'Invalid yaml: expected simple key-value pairs') Caused by multi-line default parameter values in the markdown
Object that was output from Format-SecurityPrincipal

Properties to exclude from the output because they cause problems or are unnecessary/redundant/undesirable All properties listed on a single line to workaround a bug in PlatyPS when building MAML help (error is 'Invalid yaml: expected simple key-value pairs') Caused by multi-line default parameter values in the markdown

dev:type.maml:name: [pscustomobject] One object per access control entry per account

dev:remarks.maml:para: Incomplete example but it shows the chain of functions to generate the expected input for this

maml:description.maml:para: Expand an Access Control List into its constituent Access Control Entries

Enumerate the members of the Access property of the $InputObject parameter (which is an AuthorizationRuleCollection or similar) Append the original ACL to each member as a SourceAccessList property Then return each member

Access Control List whose Access Control Entries to return Expects [System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity] objects from Get-Acl or otherwise Expects [System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity] objects from Get-Acl or otherwise Accepts any [PSObject] as long as it has an 'Access' property that contains a collection

Access Control List whose Access Control Entries to return Expects [System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity] objects from Get-Acl or otherwise Expects [System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity] objects from Get-Acl or otherwise Accepts any [PSObject] as long as it has an 'Access' property that contains a collection

dev:remarks.maml:para: Use Get-Acl from the Microsoft.PowerShell.Security module as the source of the access list This works in either Windows Powershell or in Powershell Get-Acl does not support long paths (>256 characters) That was why I originally used the .Net Framework method

maml:description.maml:para: Parse a literal path to find its server
Currently only supports local file paths or UNC paths
FQDN of the computer running this function.
Can be provided as a string to avoid calls to HOSTNAME.EXE and [System.Net.Dns]::GetHostByName()
FQDN of the computer running this function.
Can be provided as a string to avoid calls to HOSTNAME.EXE and [System.Net.Dns]::GetHostByName()

dev:type.maml:name: None. Pipeline input is not accepted.
[System.String] representing the name of the server that was extracted from the path

dev:remarks.maml:para: Return the hostname of the local computer because a local filepath was used
Return server123 because a UNC path for a folder shared on server123 was used

maml:description.maml:para: Alternative to Get-Acl designed to be as lightweight and flexible as possible Lightweight: Does not return the Path property like Get-Acl does Flexible how? Was it long paths? DFS? Can't remember what didn't work with Get-Acl TEMP NOTE: Get-DirectorySecurity combined with Get-FileSystemAccessRule is basically what Get-FolderACE does

Returns an object for each access control entry instead of a single object for the ACL Excludes inherited permissions by default but allows them to be included with the -IncludeInherited switch parameter
Path to the directory whose permissions to get
Include all sections except Audit because it requires admin rights if run on the local system and we want to avoid that requirement
Path to the directory whose permissions to get
Include all sections except Audit because it requires admin rights if run on the local system and we want to avoid that requirement

dev:type.maml:name: None. Pipeline input is not accepted.

maml:alert.maml:para: Currently only supports Directories but could easily be copied to support files, or Registry or AD providers

maml:description.maml:para: Alternative to Get-Acl designed to be as lightweight and flexible as possible TEMP NOTE: Get-DirectorySecurity combined with Get-FileSystemAccessRule is basically what Get-FolderACE does

Returns an object for each access control entry instead of a single object for the ACL Excludes inherited permissions by default but allows them to be included with the -IncludeInherited switch parameter
Discretionary Access List whose FileSystemAccessRules to return
Include non-inherited Access Control Entries in the results
Type of IdentityReference to return in each ACE
Will be sent to the Type parameter of Write-LogMsg in the PsLogMessage module
Hostname to record in log messages (can be passed to Write-LogMsg as a parameter to avoid calling an external process)
Username to record in log messages (can be passed to Write-LogMsg as a parameter to avoid calling an external process)
Hashtable of log messages for Write-LogMsg (can be thread-safe if a synchronized hashtable is provided)
Include inherited Access Control Entries in the results
Type of IdentityReference to return in each ACE
Will be sent to the Type parameter of Write-LogMsg in the PsLogMessage module
Discretionary Access List whose FileSystemAccessRules to return
Include non-inherited Access Control Entries in the results
Include inherited Access Control Entries in the results
Hashtable of log messages for Write-LogMsg (can be thread-safe if a synchronized hashtable is provided)
Hostname to record in log messages (can be passed to Write-LogMsg as a parameter to avoid calling an external process)
Username to record in log messages (can be passed to Write-LogMsg as a parameter to avoid calling an external process)

maml:description.maml:para: Alternative to Get-Acl designed to be as lightweight and flexible as possible Lightweight: Does not return the Path property like Get-Acl does Flexible how? Was it long paths? DFS? Can't remember what didn't work with Get-Acl

Returns an object for each access control entry instead of a single object for the ACL Excludes inherited permissions by default but allows them to be included with the -IncludeInherited switch parameter
Path to the directory whose permissions to get
Cache of access control lists keyed by path
Include all sections except Audit because it requires admin rights if run on the local system and we want to avoid that requirement
Include non-inherited Access Control Entries in the results
Type of IdentityReference to return in each ACE
Will be sent to the Type parameter of Write-LogMsg in the PsLogMessage module
Hostname to record in log messages (can be passed to Write-LogMsg as a parameter to avoid calling an external process)
Username to record in log messages (can be passed to Write-LogMsg as a parameter to avoid calling an external process)
Thread-safe cache of items and their owners
Hashtable of log messages for Write-LogMsg (can be thread-safe if a synchronized hashtable is provided)
Include inherited Access Control Entries in the results
Type of IdentityReference to return in each ACE
Cache of access control lists keyed by path
Will be sent to the Type parameter of Write-LogMsg in the PsLogMessage module
Include non-inherited Access Control Entries in the results
Include inherited Access Control Entries in the results
Path to the directory whose permissions to get
Hashtable of log messages for Write-LogMsg (can be thread-safe if a synchronized hashtable is provided)
Thread-safe cache of items and their owners
Include all sections except Audit because it requires admin rights if run on the local system and we want to avoid that requirement
Hostname to record in log messages (can be passed to Write-LogMsg as a parameter to avoid calling an external process)
Username to record in log messages (can be passed to Write-LogMsg as a parameter to avoid calling an external process)
